channel.title: [C4D] [WIP] Lollipop and Donut and Pen
channel.description:
i just got c4d and i made this
a lolliepop: [img]http://img521.imageshack.us/img521/9329/lolliepopee1.jpg[/img] update added a dount [img]http://img233.imageshack.us/img233/5330/wootky9.jpg[/img] lol plz rate it
pen: [img]http://img185.imageshack.us/img185/9984/penaz0.jpg[/img]
zammy pen: [img]http://img155.imageshack.us/img155/463/zammypenxh1.jpg[/img]

item.title: [C4D] [WIP] Lollipop and Donut and Pen
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“nator123123, post:21, topic:155804”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=212618.msg1858970#msg1858970 date=1193881902]

And don’t listen to Nator. That is not the way to do it, well at least the first option he had listed.

And since when is adding a ring primitive productive?

There is no lighting, materials, or composition invovled here.
[/quote]
Both of the ways work, I’ve used them.

And, the pen:
The little red thing that is used for hook on the cap should be spread out more, because that is what most are like.
And at the end of the pen, not the cap, it should have a little bump there, because that’s how some are.

Nice work, but I don’t like the Zammy pen, has bad color mixture to me.[/quote]

It doesn’t matter if it works, that is not the way to do it.
The first way you are not adding a material to the object, you are just changing the display color. Nothing else.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] [WIP] Lollipop and Donut and Pen
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:8, topic:155804”]And don’t listen to Nator. That is not the way to do it, well at least the first option he had listed.

And since when is adding a ring primitive productive?

There is no lighting, materials, or composition invovled here.[/quote]
Both of the ways work, I’ve used them.

And, the pen:
The little red thing that is used for hook on the cap should be spread out more, because that is what most are like.
And at the end of the pen, not the cap, it should have a little bump there, because that’s how some are.

Nice work, but I don’t like the Zammy pen, has bad color mixture to me.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] [WIP] Lollipop and Donut and Pen
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“wixter, post:15, topic:155804”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=212618.msg1860362#msg1860362 date=1193964823]

Excuse me, putting primitives together is not really making anything.

Seriously learn to model something, this is a joke.

When you can post something that people will actually wonder if it’s real or not, then start posting.
[/quote]
Dont be so harsh. This is the graphics section is it not? Its not the “uber pr0 gfx section dont post if your shit”, Let him post what he wants aslong as its to do with graphics. No matter how good or bad.[/quote]

STFU, SomethingToHide knows what he’s talking about when it comes to this. And it may not be the “uber pr0 gfx” section but it isn’t the “come and post absolute shit before reading tutorials” section either.

dragonus18:

you spelled donut wrong

So did you… doughnut.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] [WIP] Lollipop and Donut and Pen
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“wixter, post:15, topic:155804”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=212618.msg1860362#msg1860362 date=1193964823]

Excuse me, putting primitives together is not really making anything.

Seriously learn to model something, this is a joke.

When you can post something that people will actually wonder if it’s real or not, then start posting.
[/quote]
Dont be so harsh. This is the graphics section is it not? Its not the “uber pr0 gfx section dont post if your shit”, Let him post what he wants aslong as its to do with graphics. No matter how good or bad.[/quote]

You don’t know C4D. The equivalent of what he is doing is like making a square in paint and filling it with brown. Maybe even easier.

I would not ever consider this for anything, unless it’s a what not to do.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] [WIP] Lollipop and Donut and Pen
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:

[quote=“killerman93, post:16, topic:155804”][quote author=wixter link=topic=212618.msg1861586#msg1861586 date=1194029102]

Excuse me, putting primitives together is not really making anything.

Seriously learn to model something, this is a joke.

When you can post something that people will actually wonder if it’s real or not, then start posting.

Dont be so harsh. This is the graphics section is it not? Its not the “uber pr0 gfx section dont post if your shit”, Let him post what he wants aslong as its to do with graphics. No matter how good or bad.
[/quote]

In C4D, it’s different to photoshop, you need to actually follow tutorials first. Exploring it you werent learn anything, so stfu.[/quote]

Well lets not ruin his thread with flame, somethingtohide has had years of C4D experience and has been a great help to me with it, if you want help from him just message him but you really should read tutorials

item.title: [C4D] [WIP] Lollipop and Donut and Pen
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Sooo… You took a Primitive shape and added some color to it? Nice work. Except it lacks reality. A glazed donut(I just happened to be looking at one <3) its crusted all over. Nothing is smooth, it has rough edges all over. Yours is a solid shape…

The Lolipop is also in need of work. Have you ever seen a blow pop? It has a VERY rough texture. Broken pieces and bumps all over it. Make it a little more realistic.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] [WIP] Lollipop and Donut and Pen
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Wow, better than my first, good job. And this is how to add color:
click on object -> Attributes Windows -> Basic -> Switch “Use Color” from OFF to ON -> Display color to Color you want.
Or, Materials Window -> File -> New Material -> Attributes Window -> Color Section -> Change colors
then,
Drag your material to your object in the Objects Window.
Hoped this helped.

Read full topic

Also, look into materials.
